title: 115_hr3077
content: The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals the Retirement Earnings Test. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals various subsections of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to Section 203. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals and makes amendments to subsections of the Social Security Act, including redesignating paragraphs and subsections. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" makes amendments to subsections of the Social Security Act, including redesignating paragraphs and subsections. Amendments include changes to subsections (c), (d), and (e) by updating references to subsection (b) and removing specific subsection references. Additional conforming amendments are also made to Section 202(n)(1) regarding benefits terminated upon deportation. In subsection (e), subsection (g) or (h)(1)(A) is replaced with subsection (d). Additional conforming amendments are made to Section 202(n)(1) of the Social Security Act. Section 402(n)(1) of the Social Security Act is amended by replacing references to Section 203(b), (c), and (d) with just Section 203(b). Section 202(q) is also amended to update exemptions from reductions based on early retirement. Section 203(c)(2) is amended to replace references with "section 203(b)(1)". Section 202(s) is amended regarding exemptions from reductions based on certain entitlements to child's insurance benefits. The Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017 and deductions under section 222(b) are amended. Section 202(s) is also amended to exempt reductions based on entitlements to child's insurance benefits. The Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017 and deductions under section 222(b) are amended to update provisions related to the suspension of aliens' benefits in section 202(t)(7) of the Act. The Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017 updates provisions related to the suspension of aliens' benefits in section 202(t)(7) of the Act by amending subsections (b), (c), and (d) to subsection (b). Provisions in the Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017 are updated to reduce benefits based on maximum benefits and penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings. The Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017 is amended to adjust deductions from benefits based on earnings and benefit computation years. The Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017 is amended to adjust deductions from benefits based on earnings and benefit computation years, including provisions related to earnings and benefit computation years. The Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017 is amended to adjust deductions from benefits based on earnings and benefit computation years, including provisions related to rounding of benefits and defining income for purposes of SSI. The Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017 is amended to adjust deductions from benefits based on earnings and benefit computation years. Provisions relating to rounding of benefits and defining income for purposes of SSI are also included. The Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017 is amended to adjust deductions from benefits based on earnings and benefit computation years. Provisions relating to rounding of benefits and defining income for purposes of SSI are also included. The term 'wages' is redefined for paragraph (1)(A) without regard to specified limitations on remuneration amounts. Services not constituting employment as defined in section 210, performed within the United States, are considered in the computation. The computation of earnings for benefits is adjusted under the Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017, redefining 'wages' without limitations on remuneration amounts. Services performed within or outside the United States are considered employment if the remuneration is not included in the individual's net earnings for title II purposes. The term 'wages' does not include certain payments made to employees or their dependents for retirement purposes, as defined under the Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017. The term 'wages' excludes payments made to employees or their dependents for retirement, as specified in the Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017. Repeal of deductions on account of work under the Railroad Retirement Program. The Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to repeal deductions on account of work under the program, removing subsections (f) and (g)(2) while redesignating subsection (g)(1) as subsection (g). The Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to remove deductions on account of work under the program by striking subsections (f) and (g)(2) while redesignating subsection (g)(1) as subsection (g). Conforming amendments are also made to related sections of the Act. Conforming amendments are made to the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 by removing deductions related to work under the program. This includes amending sections 3(f)(1) and 4(g)(2) of the Act. The amendments to section 231c(g)(2) remove certain deductions, effective for taxable years ending after December 31, 2018.
